fullText: Despite being a musical-opera aficionado, I had seen “Funny Girl” performed on stage only once. The experience was half-memorable, half-forgettable. On Sept. 23, 2002, the Actors’ Fund of America presented a benefit performance of the 1964 musical that had made Barbra Streisand a star. At the one-night-only benefit, Peter Gallagher played Nick Arnstein and Kaye Ballard, a performer who lobbied hard to be the original Fanny Brice, played Mrs.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This appears to be the opening of a longer article that provides background context about previous productions, but contains no evaluation of the current Broadway production being reviewed.; openai: The text provided is a personal anecdote and historical context about a past performance, not a review of the current Broadway production.; gemini: The text describes a past performance of Funny Girl, not a review of the current Broadway production.; kimi: The text describes a one-night-only benefit performance of 'Funny Girl' from September 23, 2002, not a current Broadway production.
